title: Action Learning-Based Management Problem-Solving Competency Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Management Theories and Mathematical Modeling
context.additional_context: Conducted in an environment enabling real-time collaboration and data analysis using digital devices, utilizing actual workplace problems as learning topics

learning_goals: Learners systematically analyze math-based business problems from real work environments following an action learning team’s problem-solving process.
Applying the six-stage action learning process (problem definition–action plan–data collection–solution generation–implementation–reflection), learners design quantitative decision-making models.
Based on insights derived during learning, learners propose organizational improvement plans endorsed as feasible by over 80% of team members.

resources: Data Visualization Software (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
